author: {'steamid': '76561198033263509', 'num_games_owned': 2923, 'num_reviews': 570, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1490362927}
review:
Когда  я  в  первый  раз  запустил  эту  игру,  я  не  мог  понять,  что  в  ней  не  так,  почему  у  неё  смешанный  рейтинг?  Викинги  плюс  симулятор  постройки  поселения,  как  можно  запороть  эту  идею?  Оказалось  очень  даже  легко,  поиграв  буквально  пару  часов,  приходит  осознание  того,  что  Valhalla  Hills  просто  до  одури  однообразна.

Здесь  нет  какого-либо  сюжета  или  игровой  кампании.  Нас  каждый  раз  забрасывает  на  случайно  сгенерированную  карту.  После  десантирования  мы  включаем  максимальную  скорость  и  строим  дома  ремесленника  и  лесоруба,  заказываем  два  топора,  два  молота,  удочку,  два  серпа,  лопатку  пекаря.  Затем  возводим  каменоломню,  лесопилку,  дома  камнетёса  и  рыбака.  На  этом  первостепенные  нужды  утолены  и  у  нас  есть  стабильный  прирост  материалов  для  дальнейшего  строительства,  но  на  рыбе  и  ягодах  викинги  долго  не  протянут,  потому  возводим  хижину,  ферму,  мельницу,  пекарню,  вторую  ферму,  вторую  хижину.  Пищевая  инфраструктура  налажена,  необходимая  численность  викингов  для  победы  также  достигнута,  можно  достраивать  оружейника  и  лагерь  армии.  Оружейнику  выдаём  двух  носильщиков  для  ускорения  процесса  и  заказываем  пять  каменных  топоров  и  четыре  посоха  целителя,  в  лагере  армии  нанимаем  соответствующих  оружию  викингов  и  вперёд  на  зачистку  портала!

В  игре  имеется  вдвое  большее  количество  построек  для  добычи  металла,  укрепления  боевого  духа  пивом,  разведении  скота  и  прочего,  но  всё  это  не  нужно,  ибо  ваши  молодцы  с  каменными  топорами  и  посохами  из  веточек  справляются.  Не  знаю,  что  будет  дальше,  но  такой  не  хитрой  стратегией  я  успешно  произвёл  штурм  двадцати  пяти  холмов.  И,  как  не  сложно  догадаться,  испытал  горькое  разочарование  и  дикую  скуку,  ибо  однообразие  буквально  убивает.

Плюсы:  отсутствуют.

Минусы:  однообразие.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022551700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1432, 'last_played': 1490390905}
review:
I was surprised by all the negative reviews because not only is this game fun, but it is challenging too. Maybe the other reviewers didn't play it long enough to encounter the Dark Gnomes or the Skeleton Warriors. Also, there is a progression path with unlocks based on the things that you do. So, the more you play, the more you can unlock and do "extra" stuff that you couldn't do before, which makes the game even more fun. 

At almost 20 hours, I have 50% of the achievements, so I'm estimating 40 hours of gameplay before I "complete" the game. But then there's a harder game mode that I haven't even tried for the "elite" players. 

I think too many people give up before they give the game a chance. I admit the first few hours, as I was trying to figure stuff out, I agreed with most of the negative reviewers. But now that I have played more of it and understand how things work, I found that it is a pretty fun game. 

Besides, the music/soundtrack is pretty darn good too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029739150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1490320776}
review:
For the first hour or two I was very engaged and delighted by this game. Reminding me of the old Majesty series with a Banished-like twist to it I was quickly locked in for several hours and nights of gameplay. However, after playing through a dozen or so of the "missions" I quickly realized that this game is not very deep and quite frankly is not all that exciting once you realize "that's it?" is really "that's it". This game is about 10 years too late to be a solid contender for modern games. 

Pros:
Fun premise
Great colors and charming graphics
Simple to learn

Cons:
Lacking depth
No real need for intense strategy; same plan works every time
UI / Controls not all that great

Not worth full price, maybe worth it on a $1.99 or $0.99 sale. Try Banished instead or reinstall an old RTS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041295896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1617547221}
review:
Em Valhalla Hills você deve fazer sua tribo de vikings ganharem honra, seja lutando, construindo, ou lutando um pouco mais, para que sejam vistos dignos de entrar em Valhalla!
Do conteúdo do jogo gostaria de destacar:

-Seus vikings podem construir um arco grande de edifícios,  e utilizar de um arco médio de equipamentos e armas.
-Suas cidades se tornarão auto-sustentáveis depois de um tempo.
-O jogo possui poucos possíveis inimigos, a menos que possua as dlcs.
-Os gráficos são muito bonitinhos, então crianças e adultos podem jogar e se divertir no mesmo nivel.

Agora minha opinião opinativa opinial:

É um jogo bom pra xuxu. É muito divertido direcionar seus vikings, nomea-los e leva-los a combate. Mais divertido ainda quando finalmente tem honra suficiente para ir pra valhalla, da um orgulho do caramba isso : D
Dei o nome de Irineu pra um viking, que por sua vez tornou-se trabalhador de deposito.
Minutos depois pobre Irineu aparece morto na floresta sem motivo aparente.
Podem comprar sem medo que vão gostar sim, não sei como raios o jogo não recebeu mais atenção do publico.

Nota extra:.

Há alguns jogos que lembram a mecanica do valhalla e também o gameplay:
- Knights and Merchants
- Cultures 1/2
- Que eu me lembre só.

10/10

Irineu: você não sabe nem eu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058384400', 'num_games_owned': 586, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1590143664}
review:
Not Worth the Money. 

When i first saw this game on Youtube being played i immediately wanted it. It ticked all the boxes for me, that being; RTS, Sandbox, vikings and creation. Simply to me it looked good. After completely forgetting about it for over a year it popped up on the humble bundle. I paid £8.21 for Valhalla Hills along with another 7 games which to me was a BARGIN! 

So i started playing it and was thrown into the story which was cool but then immediately i ran into issues with the game. I could not change the camera angle and it was stuck at an almost horizontal level. On googling this and trying to find guides i discovered you had to use the mouse wheel button, not scrolling the wheel, instead pressing it down. Now my mouse does not have the ability to do this and i met a lot of people online with the exact issue. So i then thought "Okay i must strive forward" and got into the game. It's fun for the first 20 minutes and you constantly seem to unlock things but i soon started to realise something. This game is fundamentally the exact same level over and over. (Unless you consider more monsters and a different ((similarly looking)) island a big change) 

That meaning you always have to build from nothing and get through the portal. I am unaware of how many missions there are but i can tell you from a little bit of research the game always has that same quest for you to complete. This would be fine but when playing from a nearly horizontal view it soon became very difficult to just see what it was i was building or what was going on around me. 

Along this i had many other simple issues (Some of which i feel might have been solved if i had played a bit longer but alas, i will not being playing anymore) Woodcutters seem to destroy all the forests and do not replant anything meaning you eventually run out of wood, your people cannot seem to find their building materials very fast even if they are in plentiful reserve, without food your entire village populus seems to die without much warning and can put your game to a halt. 

In conclusion i can say that this game is cute but lacks very simple things that make it personally unplayable for me.  I would say if you can get into it then it might be worth buying on sale £8 or below but for the price of £23.99 it is NOT worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135223196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1489871541}
review:
这个游戏潜力感觉其实挺大的，比较休闲，有点刚玩英雄无敌的感觉，搜集资源，挑战一个强敌。
但是也有个问题，因为玩过海岛大亨和文明，这款游戏的确是不够精致的，系统看起来完善，但是实际操作起来却有点天际线的那种放养的感觉。论战斗系统和养成系统，这款游戏简化了很多步骤，如果只是单纯的想试试一个全新的不那么复杂养成界面，或许这个游戏可以作为过渡。但是你要是想要更多的钻研建筑学，钻研人口规划，钻研战斗，那么这款游戏可能确实缺了那么点深度。
感觉中上，我觉得是可以值得尝试的一款比较用心的模拟经营。

author: {'steamid': '76561197994725389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1490736432}
review: Un juego sin tutorial es como una piscina sin agua. Tardaras 5 minutos en saber como empezar a jugar. Tardaras otros 5 minutos en saber que hacer por primera vez en el mapa porque no habra nada que te lo explique. Tardaras 5 minutos en darte cuenta que estas perdiendo el tiempo. Tardaras 5 minutos en quitar el juego. Conclusion: habras gastado 20 minutos de tu vida y desinstalaras el juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050700145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1489852893}
review:
Nice idea, frustrating execution.

I really like the general idea of a Viking themed simulation game, especially with the sort of overarching progression that the game is aiming for. The game runs well on my 2-year old midrange PC, and I find the aesthetic pleasing - especially the ice themed enemies, which shine prettily at night. It really hits that sweet spot of concept and visuals which hooked me in right away.

However, when it comes to the gameplay I find it frustrating and slow. On the first play, there is a LOT of text to read and understand, while there's not a lot to actually *do*. Even when gameplay gets more advanced, there's little real choice regarding the builds you make. Supply chains are finnicky to set up, difficult to monitor, and there is little control over whether it works. You can't choose which Vikings fill which roles, or provide them any specific orders. Vikings working at a building very slowly carry the resources they need from wherever they happen to be lying, and it's painful to start the game and have to wait several days for the first axes to be ready to use. This frustration is a little mitigated by the Courier and Carrier systems, where you can add workers to a building to stock it with resources, but this adds different frustrations - such as the Leather you start with being stored (irrevocably) in a building you don't want it in.

The Vikings themselves are not very clever. I have had several starve because they wouldn't walk another meter to get food, and one or two get into an endless loop of being beaten to a bush to pick food, turning round, walking home, repeat. Some woodcutters have endlessly punched trees, complaining about missing tools, even when there's a perfectly good axe sitting in the next building across. This is where the lack of ability to easily monitor supply chains gets very annoying, because hungry Vikings can break your food supply chain and make others starve.

But these supply chain problems mean it's impractical to get an army going early on, and hence some maps (with restricted space and lots of enemies) become unfun, with many restarts required to find the pixel-perfect building placement.

When the map specifics are nice, the stars align, and you do get things right, it's a satisfying experience watching your well oiled machine produce warriors which can carve Ice Golems into table centerpieces. But these experiences come along too late in the game, are infrequent, and outside of those experiences the game doesn't execute the fantasy well enough.

Play this game for the aesthetic and to appreciate what others in the genre do really well. Don't play it expecting extended fun, even in the Dwarf Fortress sense of "fun".

author: {'steamid': '76561197977731571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1489828498}
review:
Agree with most of the other negative reviews.

During the first 30 minutes, there were a lot of nice things to learn about the game, such as that roads extend the reach of buildings, in a dynamic way, and that you get a lot of the same vikings back as you play the game, but ultimately, the game is repetitive, and not in a fun way. Depending on RNG, you might even start close to enemy units, which can lead to a sort of "half death" for your people, where they kill them before you get a proper chance to build an small militia, but don't kill your base, meaning you just get new vikings, that struggle to get new resources and new weapons, all in a cycle of slowly unlocking new buildings and map modifiers, in a vein attempt to introduce replayability to a game that really is just not fun enough to begin with. Only good thing, is I got this from a humble bundle, so I didn't pay the full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969527004', 'num_games_owned': 867, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1489602343}
review:
As much as I wanted to like and recommend this game, I just can't. There's no real challenge here, and while I appreciate the nods to the Settlers series (placing buildings with specific functions, no direct control over my Vikings, careful micro-management of supply chains), there's not much else to do.

Here's how a typical level goes:

Place buildings to get production going
Micro-manage the production of materials, food, weapons when the supply chain breaks down
Produce soldiers when food production is sufficient
Place army camp close to a "portal" to release hostile creatures
Defeat hostile creatures in a fight that literally takes less than 10 seconds
Proceed to next level

Initially, I enjoyed the Settlers-like vibe to the production/supply chain management, and I liked seeing my Vikings carrying goods between locations and using the road system I'd built them, but it got old very quickly. 

I have no idea *why* I am doing any of this, who my enemies are or what benefits I get from defeating them. It's just rinse, repeat ad nauseum. The only gameplay variances come from the unlocks, which open new buildings, terrains and technologies for use, but none of these have proven to be game-changers yet.

After 10+ hours, I'm left feeling like this is an unfinished game, and that I should rather go dig up my copy of The Settlers IV instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992866082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 13037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4230, 'last_played': 1494336494}
review:
ゲーム内容云々以前にUIやコントロールが悪い。最悪なのはローカリゼーションで、何を言っているのか意味不明なレベル。テキストがきちんと表示されないこともある。英語でプレイした方がマシだと思ったが、なぜか言語の切り替えもできない。最悪。

言語に関しては何度かリロードするときちんと表示されるようになり、ようやくまともにプレイできたが、バイキングのAIにバグなのか仕様なのか微妙な挙動がある。楽しめないこともないが、やはり全体としては雑なゲームとしか言いようがない。正直７割引でもおすすめはできない。

author: {'steamid': '76561198039509374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1489334731}
review:
You are the exiled God of builders, sent away by your father Odin because he`s an arsehole and now have to work your way back into Valhalla. You start out on a small island and move your way to larger and larger land masses. All fine and dandy until you get to the game mechanics that don`t really work that well. The warriors are gathered around a large pole and unable to locate an axe even if the all-seeing mighty Odin came down from the heavens and shoved it up their arses shaft down and them sqeezed them all into vaze-like ornaments. They do respond when enemies appear but the combat is as exciting as watching drool going down my 6 mo chin. The rest of the buildings kind of work, but there`s not clear way of getting an idea of the level of production a building has nor can you see the radious of a building after making it.

You go on to a repetitive series of missions where you get access to more and more buildings and vikings. The camera work is shabby, the visuals are something a pimple faced teenager can do in a couple of sleepless nights in his parent`s basement, the feeling the game gets you is like the one of watching paint dry. The first settler games, released 10 years before this were better made. 

This is a half arsed attempt from the devs. This is the first review I`ve written, despite having more than 100 games just to tell people just how boring and bland this game is. It has absolutely nothing going for it. Go get Knights and Merchants or the early Settler games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006063182', 'num_games_owned': 700, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1489576128}
review:
Not worth the $30 price tag. More like a $5-$10 game.
Super simple gameplay. Think Banished but with way smaller maps, no deaths, no real way to direct your people, and restarting every 20mins.
Could be an interesting game if they made the maps bigger and made building a bit more rewarding. As is i'm just rushing axes with minimal food and blowing past the guards.

The game is a cheap $10 game that you might spend an hour or two playing if you are really really into it. I was not and did not. And with the price tage of $30 I can not recommend this game at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977985046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1489528688}
review:
Dieses Spiel simuliert perfekt eine kleine Gemeinschaft von kurzsichtigen, engstirnigen und ignoranten Wikingern.
Die Kollegen sind scheinbar 24/7 mit Met zugeschüttet und sehen es überhaupt nicht ein Ware von A nach B zu bringen.
Beispielsweise stellt der Steinmetz einfach mal die Arbeit ein, da es keine Hämmer zum Steine kloppen gibt.
Zumindest nicht im Umkreis von 20 Metern.... 
Während der Steinmetz noch ohne Werkzeug die 3 in der Nähe befindlichen Läger in die nur Nahrung geliefert wurde betrachtet kippen weiter im Osten der Siedlung die Wikinger-Kollegen reihenweise aufgrund Mangelnder Nahrung tot aus den Latschen, weil im Lager kein platz für Essen war, denn: Das Lager ist voll mit Hämmern.
Vor allem die Krieger sehen es nicht ein mal ein paar Schritte zu machen um sich eine Axt zu holen.
Wozu auch? Der fiese Eisgolem prügelt ja schließlich grad den Jäger am anderen Ende des Dorfes zu Klump. 
Hier ist also alles in Butter.
Auch marodierende "Monster" (Geister, Golems, Wölfe und anderes Viehzeug) werden gern mal ignoriert.
Wenn einer der NordmännerInnen (#politicalcorectness) zufällig auf dem selben weg ist, wie ein Kollege, dem grade die Klötze von einem Wolf rasiert werden, wird gern mit angepackt. Ist der Zielort aber auf der 1 Hexagon (ca. 1,5 Meter) vorher liegenden Weggabelung, dann ist das wohl ein Fall von persönlichem Pech. 
"Diesen Harald hab ich eh noch nie gemocht. Soll ihn Fenris holen!"

Es kommt einem so vor, als hätten die ehrenhaften Krieger aus Valhalla allesamt Probleme mit den Augen und das letzte was ihnen in den Sinn käme, wäre es miteinander zu reden.
Olaf: "Du Bjarne, du stehst ja 5 Meter weiter westlich als ich.... Siehst du in dem Lager noch Waffen?"
Bjarne: "WER HAT DAS GESAGT?! ZEIG DICH!" 

In dem Spiel geht es darum, dass den gefallenen Helden der Zutritt nach Valhalla verwehrt wird, da die Götter grade ihre Cojones chillen, oder einfach besseres zu tun haben. Exakt wie die hier (mehr oder weniger) tätigen Protagonisten!
Dem Spieler wird schnell klar, wie diese --->gefallenen<--- Helden wohl ihr Ableben gefunden haben um überhaupt in das Reich der Toten zu gelangen.

War für den Preis Im Humble Bundle Ok. Ein teuer Kauf über Steam wäre aber nichtmals nach 3 Eimern Met zu entschuldigen!

Bewertung:
Ich krieg die "Tyr" nicht zu / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198168823046', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1489439678}
review:
Got it for around 35p in the humble bundle. Its not even worth that.

A good idea ruined by an awful way of presenting itself. It has no real tutorial, essentialy when you click on something it explains, very breifly, what it does...thats it. Meaning you are supposed to understand and then act on brief descriptions of a game that you arn't fully told how to play.

All in all it is spoliled by this, as you cant understand the basic needs of your workers, beause it doesnt tell you until you activate the item corrosponding with the need...the need you didnt know existed.

A real shame 2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198045758384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1489328544}
review:
I just can't do it, put some time in and I have to say I am pretty bummed because it looked great. Glad I got it for cheap on Humble Bundle.

Pros:
-Great graphics, especially at night.
-Terrain encourages you to think about your layout and infrastructure.
-Interesting idea of sending Vikings to Valhalla based on how they perform.
-Unlock content as you play, giving incentive to keep going.

Cons:
-I quickly started to just not care about my village or my inhabitants. There is no real campaign, just bigger and bigger maps where you have to do the same thing over and over starting from scratch every time.
-Feels unfinished, clunky and awkward to play and like it should be played on a mobile device.
-Way too expensive. If you plan to try it wait for a sale. Like a huge one. 
-Frustrating bugs, sometimes things just don't work. Vikings don't use available resources, odd graphical lag, etc...
-Minor last point, I get the cartoon-graphic thing is nice sometimes but it's just silly here. It felt like watching Nickelodeon or something, not leading a band of Vikings to Valhalla.

In the end this was not fun at all. I have to decide where to invest my time and this game made me not want to hit the play button.  Skip it and check out the many other better and cheaper offerings in the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983040117', 'num_games_owned': 1744, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 982, 'last_played': 1489385946}
review: It's a cute little building and logistics sim. It's not particularly challenging (particularly if you avoid the military aspects and go for production goals to beat every level), but it's well-made and designed with love. The flavor and art are spot on and there's a wide variety of complexity. That said, the design isn't perfect. The camera gets a little clunky at times, the gameplay is repetitive, and it's possible to get into vicious cycles of needing a resource but all vikings are unable to provide it due to hunger or severe damand for something and it's not always clear what you can do to resolve it. Still, I'm a fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989009257', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1492462622}
review:
This game is really nice to play, thats the 1st thing you think when you see the trailers, and gameplay. . It cheats you to play it, I had it on my radar for a while now, and bought it recently with the Humble Bundle, and I have to say, it was a total disappointment to me. 

It got nice mechanics, but its implitation isnt good, I found my self playing the game without understanding anything, I didnt find a tuturial mode to help me play the game, and the idea that you learn while you play, it didnt work with me. 

Other players are saying that it is very dumped down and streamlined, for me it was very complicated, I found myself struggling to understand what to do and what needs to be done. I understood the concept of opening the portal and heading to the next map/level. But the City building mechanics where not clear to me, I didn't understand how to gather resources, there was no building chain, This game mainly needs a better gameplay interface. 

After reading alot and watching gameplay videos, it made alot of things clearer to me, I wish the developers had the game easy to understand, and made the work flow of resources viewable and understandable.

I am not asking for an easy game, I am asking for an understandable one. A one were you can know what you need, and how you can achieve it. 

I will still recommend this game, cause after you get pass the interface, its fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994535027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1499565572}
review:
tldr: This game is not worth 30$/€, at all.
(I got my game in a 1$ bundle and still can't force myself to play it more after some islands).



I wanted to like this game but it's pretty mediocre.

Simple for the brain but tedious for the hands. You can enter loopholes in the production blocking the progression and forcing you to restart, it's not a big deal once you know it but it's frustrating and 1 aspect of the many poor design choices.

Interface is cardboard, not really fun to navigate through. IA is idiotic, uses longer trajects than expected, they talk to sleeping Vikings. 

Graphics are ok but I suspect Steam pictures to be 4K or shopped. In 1080p and all Max, the render is really inferior to those pics (Tweaking GPU pannel should not be the step to match those pics).

Anyway maybe for 13€ I'd be neutral but for 30€ avoid it at all cost.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984747778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1489341467}
review: Po všech stránkách horší než předchůdce Cultures 2. Repetitivní, nudné, bez příběhu, neodůvodněně náročné na HW, nulová ovladatelnost jednotek, málo budov, stavba je strašný opruz,... a dalších tisíc problémů. Pozitiva žádná. V žádném případě to není nástupce série Cultures. Zklamání... Valhalla Hills se vyhněte obloukem a zahrajte si raději Cultures 2 nebo Settlers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012507724', 'num_games_owned': 1865, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1489329296}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056633723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1489297344}
review: It's an OK game, but too much is up to the faulty AI. You can only control your buildings, not your Vikings - they do everything automatically and the way they make their decisions is not clear. After a few hours of gameplay, I found that I was googling too much about how things work and the whole thing had just become a quest to unveil the mysteries of the Viking's seemingly random behavior instead of a fun game to play. At this price, there are much better games in this genre available right here on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011446843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1575926008}
review:
Also eigentlich amcht das Spiel richtig spaß für so ein bischen zwischendurch gewussel. 

Doch ein großer Kritikpunkt meinerseits ist die KI der eigenen Spielfiguren. Sie hat mich bis jetzt nciht nur einmal auf die Palme gebracht, nicht nur das die Dorfbewohner in meinen Augen die hergestellte Nahrung irgendwie Ignorieren um dann lieber in den Wald zu rennen um sich dor neben einem Rudel Wölfe Pilze zu sammeln(und dabei zu 90% ins Gras beißen).Selbst die Heiler in einem Soldatentrupp rennen lieber erstmal zum Lager hin und ignorieren die Kameraden die gerade am kämpfen und sterben sind, was mich schon einige gute Krieger gekostet hat.

Dennoch würde ich das Spiel empfehlen für das kleine Wikinger gewusel zwischendurch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155125098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1489217904}
review:
Because so much of the game is automated, the rules behind the systems are too opaque for this to be an engaging resource manager--I don't know why I'm doing what I'm doing, and it doesn't seem to matter much anyway. The tutorials aren't much help.

The camera is annoying: you can somewhat, unsatisfactorily adjust the tilt and zoom but you can't swing around the Y axis. No matter what you do, you'll never feel like the camera placement is right. Valhalla Hills was made in Unreal Engine 4, but it doesn't show on screen; the developers could have accomplished the same cartoony aesthetic in Unity.

Who would enjoy this game? Maybe children. Their standards are low enough. AVOID

author: {'steamid': '76561197979519257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1498342885}
review: Didn't care for it. I felt stupid because I didn't understand why I couldn't control anything or make any decisions. Turns out all you do is build some buildings. There is some strategy to building the buildings, but generally looks like if you had the basic formula for which buildings to build in order then you could use that on every single map. It might be a good introductory game for someone who is new to PC gaming and strategy games in general.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040842672', 'num_games_owned': 3000, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1489091604}
review:
Valhalla Hills is a city builder that is quite similar to early Settlers games. Unfortunately the whole game feels highly unpolished and it's looking very unlikely that any of the issues will ever be fixed.

The basic city building gameplay is decent but not great. The production chains are rather simple and the game is missing a number of core features and UI tools I'd expect in a good city builder. I strongly disliked the courier network system, too. Combat is also pretty terrible, but that's frankly normal for the genre.

The procedurally generated maps are rather repetitive and there's no proper campaign mode. In Classic mode you simply keep playing through new random maps slowly unlocking new buildings and stronger enemies. The game could have used much more variation with the maps and the objectives. There's also the Open game mode where everything is unlocked from the beginning, but you are still playing on the same repetitive random maps so this feels somewhat pointless.

Production values are not particularly good either. I wasn't a big fan of the highly generic art style which reminded me of mobile games. Music is decent but way too repetitive and the sound effects are minimal at best.

Perhaps the biggest issue, however, is that the game is full of bugs. I ran across two critical bugs and lots of minor issues. On one map the final portal was unreachable, so the only option was to restart. On another map my military units got stuck on the scenery and the only way to fix this was to create a brand new military camp. These bugs are even more annoying as the save system in the game is extremely limited.

With more development time and extra content Valhalla Hills could have been a pretty solid city builder. Unfortunately, the game was released way too early and many of the bugs and problems were never fixed. As it is, you are much better off playing something like Settlers II 10th Anniversary Edition instead.

I played the classic mode long enough to unlock almost all the buildings but didn't ascend any of my vikings to Valhalla yet. The game just got too repetitive for me to continue.

The good:
- Core gameplay is decent enough, if not particularly deep

The bad:
- Extremely repetitive maps
- Poorly designed UI
- Generic art style
- Courier network system is annoying
- Repetitive music and minimal sound effects
- Extremely limited save system

The ugly:
- Very buggy, including several gamebreaking issues

review:
The good:
+ Good career mode - you unlock as you play buildings/features, similarly to Reus
+ Understandable and straight forward tutorial, as well as easily accessible during future games

+ Outstanding graphics and attention to detail and viking lore

The bad:
- Grindy steam achievements
- Limited content affecting replayability
- Too high steam price

author: {'steamid': '76561198233532424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1489066893}
review:
I really wanted to like this game, and unlike a lot of people who start their reviews like this and then give a game a negative review I am going to do the opposite and give it a positive review. Why? Becuase the spirit and intention of the game was really good and I feel that two little things really betrayed the game and had the developers gotten those two things right, the reviews would not be mixed but positive instead. But before I get to the bit where I talk about those two things I would like to explain what I did like about this game:


This game tried to encompass that good old citybuilder feel that was so popular about 10-15 years ago but is a lot less so today. I'm talking about games like “Settlers” where there is a nice mix between economic factors and a little bit of warrior management, but not too much. God knows there are already enough military games out there! So when I saw this game I honestly really wanted it to be like “Settlers” especially given that the people that made Settlers apparently don’t want to make that game anymore and it’s getting harder and harder to find a fun non-modern citybuilder (of course we have Tropico and Cities Skylines to scratch that itch). But I longed for one set in history hence I really wanted this to work. Now from an artistic perspective they actually get a lot right. I like the art style and interface a lot and the music is very fitting and adds to the ambience.

The first thing that really betrays this game is the camera. It is awful and is something the devs should have really prioritized. When you’re playing a citybuilder you want to seamlessly switch between an overview of your civilization and a screen that shows a smaller area where you want to do your work. It was such a little thing but I’m sure had they got that right this game would have another 5 points up on it’s score.

The second thing that really bothered me was the level system. Often they would have us build a whole town on a tiny island just to find out that the creeps at the end were quite easy and that we didn’t need to build quite so much. Then we have to start again in the next island. No, they should have just put various objectives on a single map. That would have been more fun.

Look it’s a good game and had potential to be up there but sadly those two things make the game a bit annoying to play. Perhaps I may give it more of an effort in the future but for now I will give it a positive review as I believe these devs are going the right direction.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065642831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1547680861}

author: {'steamid': '76561197964863427', 'num_games_owned': 1547, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1497901165}

Welcom to Valhalla Hills, where things never get done, because the AI is dumb as the rocks lying around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003808217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1078, 'last_played': 1451253576}
review:
This game is a dissapointment, being a fan of the Cultures series I have to admit that the dumbed down mechanics are just horrible. Vikings just fall out of from the sky, and the game has been so streamlined that all you have to do is just mass-manufacture axes and head for the gate. It feels like a half-assed product and moreover the devs are trying to get money for DLCs only add biomes to the randomly generated maps which are by themselves lackluster.

Despite buying this game on release, and rooting for it. I cannot recommend purchasing the game in its state. It feels incomplete and has no storyline. You just repeat the same thing over and over again, which is try to get to the gate and accumulate karma points...

author: {'steamid': '76561198008448580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 3153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2926, 'last_played': 1485501118}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985744997', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2696, 'last_played': 1500516290}
review:
I had this game near when it was first released. They have improved some things since then. I enjoy this game a lot. It's very relaxing. The models are ok, but I love the lighting effects. I think that maybe they could have graphs that show trends in things like food, and a prediction of when you might run out but really it isn't that big of a deal.

This isn't a game that requires intense strategy, at least not for me. It's a game where you try to do as much as you can, with as little as possible early on, then watch as your city grows to consume an entire island, and bathe it in the golden fires of your people.

I love that the bonuses to your soldiers are permanent too. I think fighting the enemy AI would be too difficult given that you have a limit on how many vikings you can call down per session.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989713436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482911700}
review:
It is an okay game. Until the 4th map I had fun. The game has some kind of bug in Windows 10 64-bit that causing the game to become unresponsive like4 minutes into the level. So I am stuck here. I did play this same level on Windows 7 and did not experiencing the problem. Oh Well, decent game got it really cheap.

Not recommended due game breaking bug and because I cannot post this without choosing one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007346480', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1482547471}

author: {'steamid': '76561198123706945', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1482398402}
review:
我选择的是推荐，那是因为这游戏确实不差，我也不想打击它。但你要问我他哪里好玩，那我也没啥好说的。
首先我对这种收集自然资源发展部落文明这件事本身是非常热衷的，小时候在工人物语还没有糊之前我还是经常玩的。
所以当我看见这游戏的类型，我就决定要体验一下了，体验结果也不差，资源分配和发展链条都很顺畅，在可再生资源的利用上还别出心裁的设计了植树造林和人工配种。
说道这里其实这个游戏真的还行，但是！这个游戏有两个偷鸡不成蚀把米的创新：这个游戏的地形是以山地为主，所以他引入了一个叫做基座的建筑结构，这代表着在陡峭地形上建造是要多花资源，其实这本身是游戏的特色，但是这个游戏是随机地图，随机的方法却并不可控，完全取决于随机生成的世界种子，所以玩家完全无法控制地图的情况，而过多的山地和分布混乱的资源让游戏的控制变得异常繁琐。其二这个游戏提出了“物流”这个神奇的部分，也是一次很好的创新，但是整个物流的AI做的...让人分分钟想退出游戏，角色不可直接操控的情况下，还强行配备了一个低能的物流系统，简直不可理喻。

author: {'steamid': '76561198183171049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1541372254}
review:
Wow. This game is awful. I've played less than an hour because it was incredibly laggy on my windows 7 pc. I recently upgraded to windows 10 and the game just crashed on the loading screen. 

This does not happen to me with any other games on my computer and didn't happen to any before I upgraded to windows 10. I'm incredibly dissapointed since this seemed like a cute city builder type of game that I normally LOVE to play. 

Recommend? I heavily advise others NOT to buy at full price. I would even hesitate to purchase this at a discount since I honestly can't even play it and when I did, it just wasn't what I expected. Waste of money IMHO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052026221', 'num_games_owned': 1286, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1481764271}
review:
Приятный визуальный стиль, старая и добрая экономическая система, викинги! Но всё это меркнет на фоне дизбаланса и отсутствия сюжета.

В начале классического режима нам позволяют погрузиться в эту приятную атмосферу и экономическую систему, но буквально через десяток уровней мы сталкиваем с противником который разматывает нас на 10-15 минуте и с ним невозможно ничего сделать. Это связано со странной системой открытий, где необходимо выполнить определенные действия, чтобы открыть строение или способности. Уже на уровне 5ом я ощутил все недостатки этой системы, вместо того, чтобы расстраивать деревню, я создал отряд викингов и отправился покорять портал, удачно его покорил и перешел на другой уровень. Но надо было остаться и расстроить деревню, выполнить определенные условия и открыть заклинания, постройки и подготовиться к могучему противнику на следующей карте. При этом вас нигде не уведомляют об этом, в самой игре это никак не фиксируется. Выходите в меню и просматриваете выполнение необходимых условий. Ужасная система создающая дикий дизбаланс.

Сюжет в игре прост, вы сын Одина и должны попасть обратно в Вальхаллу. На этом повествование заканчивается и начинается стратегия и ничего кроме стратегии. Даже когда пойдут очень дикие противники, нам не объяснят кто они такие и почему они например дружат с монстрами а мы не можем. В итоге интерес к игре быстро пропадает, но если вас удержит экономическая система, то ещё несколько уровней вы сможете пройти.

На самом деле игра скорее всего бесконечная, либо насчитывает охренно большое количество уровней. В достижениях написано, что вы должны построить 1000 построек. За всё это время я построил только 150. Хотя прошел достаточно многго уровней, около 20.

P.S.: Не считаю объективными обзоры где люди наиграли меньше 5 часов, ведь именно потом начинаются все сложности и проявление дикого дизбаласна. Будьте осторожнее.

Моя оценка 6 из 10 (Покупать на свой страх и риск)

author: {'steamid': '76561198069486039', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1469570190}
review:
[i]Je ne note pas le jeu forcément en lui-même mais plutôt d'un problème que les développeurs ne veulent pas résoudre et qui dans mon cas m'empêche de jouer au jeu, je ne fais donc pas cette critique pour pénaliser le jeu mais pour vous prévenir si d'autres sont dans le même cas :[/i]

Amis français, belges et suisses, sachez que ce jeu ne permet que le QWERTY (et seulement le QWERTY allemand et américain, pas de QWERTY anglais par exemple), aucune possibilité de passer en AZERTY ou de changer la moindre touche ou raccourcis dans le jeu (que ce soit via les menus ou les fichiers du jeu). 

C'est problèmatique car beaucoup de contrôles ne se font que via le clavier et impossible à faire via la souris, par exemple pour les caractères se trouvant sur les chiffres comme "&, é, ", ', etc" sont dans le désordre et éparpillés sur le clavier.

Exemple : là où on a l'habitude d'une suite logique comme 1 2 3 4 5 6 pour gérer les groupes 1 2 3 4 5 6, on se retrouve avec des touches isolées aux différentes extrémités du clavier alors qu'elles permettent de gérer la même chose, ce qui rend le jeu inutilisable car si la touche 1 va toujours nous permettre de gérer le groupe 1, la touche 2 va faire autre chose au lieu de gérer le groupe 2 (j'espère que c'est clair car pas évident de comprendre le problème sans avoir eu le clavier en main).

Il vous reste toujours la possibilité d'utiliser le raccourcis Windows (Left Alt + Shift par défaut) pour passer d'AZERTY en QWERTY, si vous l'avez installé (mais Windows ne permettant que de choisir entre la combinaison Left Alt + Shift ou CTRL + Alt, j'ai dû pour ma part le désactiver à cause de certains jeux ou programmes car je changeais sans le vouloir). Pas pratique donc.

Etrange pour un jeu à 30€ de ne même pas avoir une option afin de pouvoir changer la moindre touche. En tout cas, c'est bien le premier jeu auquel j'ai joué qui ne me permet même pas de changer les touches. J'ai déjà fait un tour sur les forums, aucun solution possible à part celle mentionnée dans le paragraphe précédent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970296750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1468937784}
review: Meine Spielzeit besteht hauptsächlich aus nicht spielen. Hab mehrmals irgendwann aus langeweile rausgetabbt und das Spiel im Hintergrund weiterlaufen lassen. Wer bei dem Spiel an Siedler denkt wird enttäuscht. Wer bei dem Spiel an Cultures denkt wird enttäuscht. Das Spiel wirkt wie ein "Neben her" Projekt von Entwicklern in der Mittagspause. In der Kampange macht man X mal das gleiche. Das Spiel selbst sieht nett aus, aber das wars auch schon. Irgendwann ploppen anonyme Figuren aus dem Himmel, machen automatisch irgendwas, und wenn sie sterben ist es einem völlig egal. Es gibt zu viel automatismus, zu wenig steuerbaren Inhalt. Man setzt Gebäude, das wars. Bei dem Studio werde ich ab jetzt sehr vorsichtig sein.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961394137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 828, 'last_played': 1478693178}
review:
Eintöniger Anfang, danach verhungernde Wikinger. Keine 30 Euro wert.

Die ersten Stunden baut man in jeder Mission nur die Basisgebäude. Recht langweilig soweit. Schlagartig wurde es von einer auf die nächste Mission schwer. Eine Lavawelt mit kaum Bauplätzen und vielen Gegnern verhinderte frühe Nahrungsgebäude. Das zwang die KI meiner Wikinger in die Knie. Denn hungernd arbeiten sie überhaupt nicht mehr. Keiner baut die Bäckerei trotz vorhandener Materialien. Beim zweiten Anlauf der Karte stand endlich alles zum Brotbacken. Nach drei Leib streikte dann der hungrige Holzfäller. Und ohne Holz kein warmer Ofen, also keine weiteren Brote. Wieso programmiert man so etwas? Solln sie halt nur noch stark reduzierte Leistung bringen. Aber komplette Arbeitsverweigerung bis zum verhungern? Das ist unter aller Kanone.

Lieber die originalen Cultures spielen:
1) sympatisch
2) ernährbar
3) hatten vernünftige Arbeitsbereiche
4) eine ordentliche Kampagne mit schöner Story

Oder zu Siedler 2 - Die nächste Generation greifen. Grafisch angenehm, verständliches Wirtschaftssystem und gutes Interface.

Valhalla Hills bleibt hinter dieser Referenz leider meilenweit zurück.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010367929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2477, 'last_played': 1600106389}
review:
畫面或是音樂不做評論，因為每個人喜歡不同...
就單以遊戲後的感想來寫評論就好，應該可以吧！？

這是可以慢慢玩的一款遊戲，有工人物語的感覺。
遊戲進行的節奏可以自己決定，戰鬥方面也是。
一步一步慢慢解鎖可以建造的東西跟關卡，
解鎖的有地圖大小、建築物等等...種類不少。

對於規劃有點重要，不管是路線或是建地分配，
也可以當成城市規劃下去玩，樂趣不只一種。

author: {'steamid': '76561197972275625', 'num_games_owned': 565, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1638, 'last_played': 1553127918}
review:
I dont understand all the bad reviews. This is not a 4x. it is not CIV 17.5. It is not a milsim, its just a mellow relaxing little twist on settlers. Especially settlers 1 & 2. I'm pretty sure you will like this if you liked the early settlers. (in my opinion, settlers started going downhill after 4). 

I was hesitating to buy this, as i really like the genre, but it had so many negative reviews. I watched i video by petard (who loved it) and i decided to get it.

PRO:
* the scenery is pretty and the models are cute
* you have a little more control over your troops than early settlers, but still not a lot. This is not a game for heavy military strategy. thats one of the mistakes that the settlers series ended up making
* the terrain varies from map to map providing diffferent challenges
* roads are way easier to manage than in settlers 1
* resource movement (which stumps a lot of people it seems) is important, it doesnt "just happen"  (see below)

CON:
* music is nice, but a few more tracks would be better
* you do tend to start most games placing the same buildings in the same order

RESOURCE MOVENT:
(I want to call this out seperately since this is a common complaint of even some positve reviewers. I think it is a PRO but could legitimatly be seen as a CON by some people.)

As your village gets more spread out, resources will not be distributed the way you want without doing extra work. Each building has a limited range of influence, if you have a remote fishing hut, the fish will not get transported to your central stockpile. your villagers will only make the trek out to the hut when the are starving.

Since the fisherman stops fishing when his hut is full (5 fish) this could mean that people may not have enough to eat. (hunger really slows your vikings down). There are a number of strategies to deal with this in the game. Additional stockpile workers, additional stockpiles and couriers a the three most obvious. 

This makes VH a game where you really have to think about storage an transport. Which i like  - this makes it more than just a settlers clone

SUMMARY:
if you want a military strategy or a deep 4X, look somewhere else.  If you want a relaxing town builder with cute vikings with resource management and a little fighting then you should probably get this

author: {'steamid': '76561197968536557', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8322, 'last_played': 1495310648}
review:
I had high hopes for this game (being a Settlers/Cultures fan) and played it a lot. I really liked the idea of the game and have a lot of respect for the team behind it. [b]I wish I could recommend it, but I just can't.[/b] There are non-trivial unfixed bugs (just look at the forum) and this game does not get updates anymore. Heck, I reported a bug 10 weeks ago and did not even get a response from the developers.

edit (2017-03-11): Nine months have passed since I reported the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/351910/discussions/3/351659808484916868/]bug I referred to above[/url].  Nothing has happened since then.  Neither a dev nor someone working for the publisher posted [i]anything[/i] in the VH Steam forum (which is the official forum for the game) since then.  [b]This game is definitely dead.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197992166861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1507657208}
review: Good and cozy fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973936417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 802, 'last_played': 1473010616}
review:
Ein gelungenes Spiel. Die Grafik bietet (besonders mit dem Tag- und Nachwechsel) eine gute Atmosphäre. Das Hauptaugenmerk liegt m.E. auf dem Management der Bauplätze, der Bedürfnisse der Vikinger und der Vikingeranzahl. Alle Punkte wurden gut ausbalanciert, sodass einer der Punkte schnell ins negative kippen kann, wenn man nicht gut plant. Ich hätte mir gewünscht, dass das Tutorial bei den Wohnstätten, Lagerfeuern und Trägern mehr in die tiefe gegangen wäre. Hierzu liegt aber im "Guidemenü" nun eine offizielle Anleitung bereit.

Bzgl. der Kritik der anderen Bewertert möchte ich anrühren, dass der Herausgeber selber nie mitteilte, dass er ein "neues" Cultueres oder Siedler veröffentlichen will, sondern, dass dieses Spiel ein eigenständiges ist, daher kann man es nicht negativ bewerten, wenn es selbsterfundenen Erwartungen des einzelen nicht gerecht wird.

M.E. mach das Spiel, was es soll und das gut. ;)

どこで始まるの?

author: {'steamid': '76561198010555546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1541346707}
review:
頗用心於遊戲角色的築構操作上也頗順暢，但......可能是預設是輕鬆休閒路線，每個關卡的故事性略顯單調。
當初在購買這款遊戲時我期待看到如老遊戲《宙斯》的有趣經營，但沒有呢......實在不耐玩。
不過整體遊戲頗用心，相信繼續玩下去會有更多功能解鎖吧?

author: {'steamid': '76561198050076070', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1976, 'last_played': 1479636493}
review:
我是衝著工人物語的名頭來的,
聽說是同一個團隊開發的,
玩了以後極度失望.
完全沒有工人物語的特色
1. 物資種類與經營系統, 這遊戲建築種類和物資系統可以用稀有來形容, 就那麼幾條生產系統.
2. 倉儲, 不得不說這遊戲在這點爛爆了, 和工人物語系列相比一個天上一個泥裡, 連最基本的庫存管制都沒有.
3. 物流, 工人物語的道路導航能力強到爆, 不知哪個工程師寫的, 這遊戲裡快遞員,搬運工總是卡在那不知在幹嘛.
4. 戰鬥, 工人物語複雜的兵種系統, 對我是個挑戰, 這遊戲做幾把斧頭和弓就結束了, 擺爛阿.
以經營類遊戲的角度, 我只給40分, 沒辦法世上總還會有更爛的.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169064807', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1469694574}
review:
1.打分的话6/10
2.维京人真是太能吃了，前期需要打渔捕猎，后期就种田。
3.我有一个十分文艺的维京人，一天就喜欢站在沙滩上看海，最后饿死了:)mdzz明明我的仓库里面有吃的他竟然饿死了。黑人问号？？？
4.同样是有食物，但大家都喜欢跑到深山老林里去找吃的，最后被狼和熊咬死了:)
5.有些机制不太懂，仓库里面的食物是只有一定范围里的人才回去吃么？几个快递员能形成稳定的网络么？
6.祭品需要的代价太小了，相对的生产军队需要一群后勤人员保障
7.要生产铁的话，需要地质学家->矿工->冶炼厂（游戏翻译是铁水）、烧煤的（具体名字忘了），最后好像只能用来制造更高级的武器，这条线路太麻烦了（虽然有趣..）
8.战斗系统的话，傻逼牧师不会先给血少的加。感觉一战三奶无敌了..
9.这游戏能打发时间，这很好

author: {'steamid': '76561197992783558', 'num_games_owned': 1889, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 3813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3813, 'last_played': 1467236701}
review:
Short review:
Base building game focused on space (fitting necessary buildings into limited space) and resource (how do i make enough food while still growing my town) management, with some minor combat. You beat one map and go to a new one without any particular story, and you have to start your town from scratch each time. Gets quite repetitive after you've unlocked all the buildings and figured out an optimal build pattern. Some minor AI issues are quite annoying. Recommended for fans of the genre who don't mind simpler game mechanics.

Long review:
The main challenges of gameplay:
1 - build up your town while maintaining food supply. You'll learn pretty fast what build pattern works best for food, and how to place your food buildings so that your town is well covered.
2 - deal with threats. You'll need an early military to wipe out fixed threats like wolves and bears so your town can expand. Mid game military is dedicated to wiping out dwarf colonies so they stop harassing your town. Usually that's enough for the end game - killing the portal guardians.
3 - fitting everything in. Wheat farms are super important and they need empty fertile space around them, I generally had to plan my entire town on how to fit them in.

The major negatives of the game:
- Every map you start from scratch. It's fun at first but by my 15th map or so I was pretty sick of building the same exact buildings in the same exact order. Starts to feel real grindy and repetitive.
- You can't micromanage anything. You build a woodcutter, and it would be nice if he cleared the trees from your town, but he just chooses at random from stuff in range. This renders storage buildings completely useless because you can't tell them what NOT to store - specifically food, because you need food locations spread out to cover all your other work buildings.
- Bad AI problems. You have a nicely stocked bakery or fishery but your worker will walk right past it to trek way out into the wilderness to some berry bush... right next to the wolves' den. Blergh. Or your hunter will get stuck in a loop "looking for a better weapon" when there's plenty of low-tier enemies to hunt. You don't need a bone spear go kill some rabbits and get me some meat and leather!
- Managing military is a pain. Military units suck down resources so you have to assemble an army and then disband it every time you're done dealing with a threat. You can't tell military where to go, you can only move the military camp building around the map, and your units will fight things nearby. You learn to be careful with that placement as well because the units will fight willy nilly and your healers won't focus the lowest guy, so you need to compensate with careful building placement.
- randomized maps are sometimes crap. I had one map where the exit portal was completely 100% unreachable. Or start areas will have no trees realistically in reach with enemies in the nearby woods, making fighting them off nigh impossible. Or the entire map will be peppered with mini-fjords, leaving no real open space to build an actual town. By the time I was done playing I was just resetting the map to get a decent start layout.
- the big hyped "get your units to valhalla" theme doesn't seem to actually do anything. They get a gold star or whatever but they weren't noticeably amazing. Kind of a letdown really.

All that being said, I played the game a ton, and I greatly enjoyed it up til the point where it started felling repetitive - which was about 30 hours. Not bad at all! Still it's not something I can unreservedly recommend to everyone. You have to be a fan of the base building genre (see: gnomoria, rimworld, planetbase, dwarf fortress), you have to be interested in the space and resource management elements, and you have to be cool with the game being pretty shallow mechanically. If all that sounds good to you, I say give the game a try.

review: 재밌습니다.다만 한국에선 인기가 없으므로 정보를 찾을수가 없습니다. 구글 영어로 된 공략을 보는게 가장 낫습니다.오래하면 재미는 있는데 가장 큰 문제는 듀토리얼의 부재로 인한 초반 유저들이 나가떨어지기 쉽다는 점입니다.그것을 이겨내고 깊숙히 파고들면 이제 재밌습니다. 단점으로는 수직동기화 옵션을 켰을시 화면을 빠르게 움직일 경우 이상하게 멈춤편상등이 있습니다. 수직동기화를 풀면 괸찮지만 쓸떼없는데 그래픽카드자원만 펑펑 쓰는꼴이니 다른 프레임 제한 프로그램으로 60프레임 제한을시켜주면 그래픽자원도 아끼고 화면도 멈추지가 않습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068629064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 29015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1479224615}
review:
[h1][b][u]Mini review[/u][/b][/h1]

[b]Valhalla Hills[/b] เป็นหนึ่งเกมส์ใหม่ในเกมส์แนววางแผนจัดการทรัพยากรณ์ที่สนุกเกมส์นึง เหมือนกับเอาหลายๆเกมส์มารวมกัน คอเกมส์ City builder คงน่าจะชอบ (คล้ายๆ Pharaoh + The settlers หรือมากกว่านั้น)  โดยจะให้เล่นเป็นด่าน ๆ แต่ละด่านใช้เวลาสั้นๆ  จะมีการปลดลอคสิ่งก่อสร้างไปเรื่อยๆในด่านต่อๆไป ระบบการต่างๆค่อนข้างง่าย ไม่ซับซ้อน เรียนรู้ไม่ยาก ใครอยากเล่นก็รอลดราคาแล้วค่อยมากดก็ได้ (ล่าสุดลด 80% ใน gamergate)

[h1][b][u]Pros[/u][/b][/h1]
[list]
[*] ระบบง่าย สนุก ไม่ซับซ้อน เรียนรู้ได้ไว 
[*] กราฟฟิคค่อนข้างดี ไม่อึดอัด ดูสบายตา
[*] ระบบการต่อสู้ค่อนข้างง่าย แต่ก็มีแทคนิคเยอะเหมือนกัน
[*] เกมส์ค่อยข้างสั้น แต่มีด่านเยอะ สามารถเล่นได้เรื่อยๆ
[*] เหมาะกับคนมีเวลาน้อย เพราะใช้เวลาแต่ละด่านไม่เยอะมาก
[/list]

[h1][b] [u]Cons[/u][/b][/h1]
[*] Tutorial ค่อนข้างแย่ แต่โดยรวมก็ไม่มีอะไรยาก
[*] ไม่เหมาะกับสายฮาร์ดคอร์ การต่อสู้ค่อยข้างน้อย
[*] คนและพื้นที่มีจำกัด ไม่สามารถสร้างตามใจชอบได้ 
[*] ไม่เหมาะกับคนชอบเสพเนื้อเรื่องเพราะแทบจะไม่มีอะไรเลย
[*] ระบบทหารจะบริหารค่อนข้างยาก เพราะต้องใช้ทรัพยากรซัพพอร์ทเยอะ
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198039417534', 'num_games_owned': 4953, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1464469348}
review:
You know, people always make out the Vikings and Norse mythology in general to be a complex web of intricately-woven tales of honor, bravery, and combat. I mean, with some badasses like Odin, Thor, and Loki included in the mythology, it's pretty difficult to [i]not[/i] be interested in their crazy tales. But.....what about the mythological figures no one talks about? Like Leko, the supposed son of Odin and the god of building? Does that not ring a bell? Well, I don't blame you, I'm pretty sure he's fictional, and he's coincidentally also the protagonist of this game.

[h1]The Breakdown[/h1]
Valhalla Hills begins with a brief cutscene describing the story of the game. Leko, that guy I mentioned earlier, has been banished from Valhalla by his own father, Odin, because he wasn't into fighting people or something. Poor bloke! Anyway, he now sets off to regain his father's favor by being honorable through whatever means possible. And by that, I mean building stuff and fighting stuff using his little Viking [strike]minions[/strike] people.

See, Valhalla Hills is a randomly-generated strategy game primarily focused on building with a side emphasis on combat. It's up to you, Leko, to open and enter the portal on each map through whatever means you choose. This may mean fighting the portal guardians using your Vikings or offering them various resources. Personally, I primarily like to offer resources because fighting can be pretty challenging. Regardless, just managing a town itself can be quite the struggle. You start with only a few Vikings, but by building a complex web of inter-connected buildings the process of maintaining a bunch of happy and healthy Vikings can be quite the struggle.

This is mainly because of the nature of the game. Valhalla Hills is not a story-based or progression-based RTS like what  you may be used to. Instead, the only story is given in one short cutscene, and the rest of the game plays out in randomly-generated maps with an arcade sort of feel to them. Each map could take anywhere from 10 minutes to an hour to complete, as it just depends on if you want to rush to enter the portal or not. However, depending on how you complete this task can alter how you play. If you want to fight your way to the portal, that can prove to be quite the ordeal because you would need to first build tools, harvest resources, make homes, make even more buildings, find a way to feed all of your Vikings, and finally make some soldiers to fight the portal guardians.

However, this is one area where I feel like the game is a little weak. It can be very, [i]very[/i] difficult to properly balance soldiers with food production. See, soldiers eat a bunch of food even while just sitting around, which is frustrating because it requires a constant and large supply of food to them. Yet, they can't leave their military camp for some reason, so they need to have food near them. Yet, since you can't order Vikings around or move the soldiers' camp, you need to either only use them defensively or build your town far out near the portal. I know this sounds odd, and to me it really is. It basically makes the option of fighting the portal guardians basically implausible because it'd take ages to be able to build a town large enough to both place soldiers in a path all the way to the portal (which is typically far away from your starting area) and simultaneously feed them all. Sure, after a while you can unlock couriers to transport food near soldiers, but it's still a hassle, and it's frustrating trying to do a military-based run, which takes some of the fun out of that aspect of the game.

However, despite that, attempting peaceful runs is still quite fun. It's both challenging and enjoyable to try and balance the needs of non-military Vikings while keeping them busy. When you get a successful, bustling town running finally, it's a joy to just sit and watch all your Vikings go about their daily schedules. In that sense, the game can be really rewarding. Yet, there's even more rewards given to successful playstyles in the form of unlockables. And wow, this game has a ton! Only after a few hours of playing, I've unlocked a bunch of hats, buildings, environment types, and even new enemies. It definitely helps increase the replayability of the game, which is important for arcade-style games like this that caters to people who don't want to play for hours upon hours (though that is certainly an option). Though, if you do decide to keep at it and play for a while, eventually some of your Vikings will reach Valhalla itself. This is because every Viking gains honor as you play, and when they reach 100,000 they'll ascend to Valhalla. I don't think it does much, but it's still a nice addition.

And y'know, there's a lot of little intricate details that the game includes that are quite nice just to have. Each building explains what it does and there's a mini-tutorial given at the start for most of them. In addition to that, the depth of the seemingly simple economy is quite impressive. What seems like a simple progression of getting resources --> feeding vikings --> fighting stuff/collecting portal offerings is much more complicated than that. For example, if you only have 1 fisherman but have 50 Vikings, they'll eventually go hungry, causing them to work less and less until they stop working entirely, at which point you may become doomed to failure. Or, if you chop down too many trees but don't have someone who plants new ones, you'll struggle to get more wood which can collapse a large part of the town's economy. Likewise, if you hunt too many animals and don't have an animal breeder to balance the food supply, your townsfolk may starve eventually. Sure, these are all small details, but they add up to make a fun, challenging, and engaging experience.

The game may be a little complicated gameplay-wise, but it certainly isn't graphically. Everything has a simple, cartoony look to it that I think actually works quite well. The Vikings look cute (and you can give them hats!), the environments look simple but lovely, and the animations and lighting all flow in a nice, cohesive manner. In fact, I think that's the key to this game's graphical beauty: everything just flows nicely. Unreal Engine 4's lighting capabilities probably helps with that too. Yet, despite the game's aesthetic beauty, it still runs quite nicely, at least from my experience. My computer is a little old, but the game still ran very smoothly with no issues whatsoever. Sound-wise, it's what you might expect: some nice, pleasant tunes and standard sound effects for stuff like building placement. Nothing really stood out to me there.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*]Fun, challenging, and rewarding arcade-style RTS gameplay focused on city building on a randomly-generated map (though combat is an option)
[*]Loads of replayability in the form of dozens of unlockable buildings, environment types, enemies, and hats
[*]Beautiful graphical cohesion - a big, successful town simply looks gorgeous. Thanks Unreal Engine 4! (oh, and it runs nice too)
[*]Steam achievements, trading cards, and cloud save support
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*]Story is largely non-existent besides a short initial cutscene
[*]The gameplay can become somewhat repetitive after long play sessions, so it's best played in short bursts
[*]Military-focused playstyles will suffer from a massive drain on food supplies, so be warned if you're interested in that aspect of the game
[/list]

Valhalla Hills can be a highly challenging experience, especially for those who are interested in focusing on combat. Yet, it's still certainly very satisfying to play, from witnessing the gradual progression of a tiny settlement to a bustling, sprawling city of Vikings. If you're interested in arcade-style RTS gameplay that's both fun and rewarding with beautiful graphics as well, this game is definitely worth checking out.

[h1][b]Final Verdict: 8/10[/b][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198081430111', 'num_games_owned': 2542, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1463619357}
review:
[h1]As the newly-titled "God of Building" band together with rejected heroes and earn enough honor to rejoin your father, Odin, in Valhalla. Build, fight, and prove your worth![/h1]

Story/Premise.
You are Leko, son of Odin. You have been cast out of Valhalla because, unlike the other Vikings, you prefer building to pillaging. In order to make your way back to Valhalla, you need to regain your honour by leading a ragtag group of exiled heroes through a series of maps and portals until you've amassed enough honour to ascend to Valhalla. 

The introductory cutscene is the only actual bit of story you'll get. From then on, you clear map after map in order to earn honour.

.Game play.
-Main Menu-
In the main menu, you can view your individual Viking's progress towards returning to Valhalla. Once they've earned enough honour and ascended, they can be called back down with increased combat prowess.

You can also start a new map, continue your game, and change the options (graphics, sound, the standard stuff). Additionally, you can view your progress towards unlocks here, which are presented in the form of in-game "achievements"--some of which are also Steam achievements.

Let's jump in with a new map.

-Resource management-
Welcome to the hills, God of Building! Here in this verdant collection of islands, you'll be building a settlement and fighting off enemies and wildlife. Your Viking brethren will literally fall from the sky and, once they've landed, they'll gather around your starting crystal and wait for you to build.

When you build wood cutters and quarries next to wood and rocks respectively, Vikings are automatically assigned to the task of harvesting. These materials are used to build other buildings.

Food is the most important of your resources to manage, however, because, without it, your Vikings won't work. That means no building, no hunting, no fishing, and no harvesting. Everything screeches to a halt and your Vikings can die from hunger, which means you'll likely have to restart the map. This can be done by simply clicking "restart" in the main menu.

At first, you'll rely on the berry bushes that grow in each level. They'll soon run out, however, so you'll need to assign hunters and fisherman. Those wild animals and fish can be exhausted as well, so don't rely on them too much! Build farms and bakers so that your Vikings can have a viable food source.

The other materials can be refined in order to build more complex structures. These can also be used to create tools, which make more complicated tasks such as farming and bread baking, possible. 

Vikings can also be considered a resource. You can request Vikings by building homes for them, which increases the max amount you can have at once. Take care because there's a max number of Vikings you can request, shown in the top, left corner of the U.I. If you send a bunch of them to their deaths in battle and have hit your cap for requests, you won't have enough Warriors to clear the map unless you shut down production buildings and stretch your workforce thin.

-City building-
As you progress, you unlock more options for sustainability in the hills. You begin with the ability to hunt and fish, which can exhaust its supply and run out. Once you've stripped an area of You quickly unlock more reliable options like baking and farming, which are self-sustaining. These, however, require refined materials. You also unlock things like foresters, which can replace the trees your wood cutter cuts down.

It's important to plan where you're putting your buildings. The terrain, which is sometimes more uneven than others, will hinder your placement: when you go to place a building, you're presented with three colours: green, yellow, and orange. These affect the building cost.

*Green-- the regular cost to build.
*Yellow--slightly increased cost in order to build an additional platform to compensate for the terrain.
*Orange--Greatly increased cost in order to build an additional platform to compensate for the terrain.

In true city builder style, you have no control over your Viking brethren. You can suggest tasks by placing buildings, but it's up to their discretion--and range--as to whether or not they'll hop to work. Once placed, a building has an effective range, which can be increased by linking them with paths. If your buildings are not in range of each other--say, your mill, tool maker, and wheat farm in range with your bakery--then they won't function. 

-Battle-
Warrior units differ from your regular Vikings. They can take a beating and they also won't lift a figure to build or harvest. They'll still take up your food, though, so it's a good idea to limit your number of warriors until you're ready to go on the offensive. They are key to clearing the map. After you complete a random task--i.e, build a certain building or collect x amount of resources--you're allowed to open the Portal and face the enemies that await you. You have to defeat these Portal Guardians in order to use the Portal and go to the next map. 

Battle consists of watching your Viking Warriors clash with various enemies--from wolves to otherworldly spirits. You don't play any part in it, but you can cheer them on as both parties take turns whacking each other.

After you've defeated the Portal Guardians, you'll be rewarded with a mass of honour and transported to the victory screen. In the post-battle victory screen, you'll see all of the nifty things you've unlocked by completing various objectives such as clearing various size maps or killing a certain number of enemies. Unlocks include more buildings, which offer more survival and combat options, map types, and terrains. You can also see your progress towards other unlocks by clicking an arrow to the next screen.

.Soundtrack.
The music is soaring and peaceful--a lot of wind instruments. It's the same throughout your building and warrior-rallying, changing only to reflect when your followers get into fights. 

*I found the fight music to be a little grating, especially when it shifted frequently between the two tracks every few seconds because my warriors tended to wander about and stumble into combat on larger maps. 

.Graphics/ Art Style.
Valhalla Hills is lovely. Your Vikings are stubby, cartoonish little men and women babble gibberish. The landscape--whether bright green and rife with life or crystalline white and flush with snow--is vibrant. Snow falls, the wind blows through the trees, and the waves lick at the shore to create an immersive atmosphere.

.Longevity/Difficulty.
You can clear maps in a few minutes or in over an hour depending on size. You can easily rush the objective or just sit around and develop a lovely little settlement--it's up to you. No two maps are the same so there's plenty of replayability if you just want to do a quick run or if you want to go on an honour collecting spree. Some maps are a juggling act. You'll need to prioritize getting  steady source of food, but you'll also need to manage building resources so that you don't run out and get stuck without the ability to build anything. 

There are two modes, Classic and Open Game. Classic scales in difficulty as you unlock achievements and ease your way in. Open Game allows you to dive right in with everything unlocked from the get-go and is significantly more difficult. 

.Bottom Line.
Valhalla Hills is both fun and engaging. You can play for a few minutes, or for a few hours and no two maps are the same so you'll spend your time figuring out how best to position your buildings. With two game modes and a variety of map sizes, you'll surely get your money's worth of game time. For fans of the city-building and strategy/RTS genres, Valhalla Hills is a definite yes.
